column4: anyone here have experience with NFS shares on a wireless N network?
Yes
i can't seem to get more than 8.8Mbits/s on a file transfer...that works out to 1MB/s
What is the signal report?
Have  you captured some packets to see if there are  retries?
iwconfig | pastebinit
2.4GHz porpagation requires line-of-sight and you may need to improve location(s).
http://pastebin.com/1LH9gF1v
Sorry, was on the phone

Ok signal report looks good "Link Quality=69/70"  but that is only half the story and you would have to see what it looks like from the other end.  If is that good or better, great, if it is lower, not so good....

Another thing,  you need to look at it a number of times and if you see the signal report fluctuating quite a bit, you be fairly sure that there is an interrference problem, which could be intermod or whatever.
If you have a low signal report or interference problem there will be retries...
and it could be a bad signal-to-noise ratio on either end.
In other words, there are a lot of factors to consider and some may be unseen ...
for some reason, loading a directory on the nfs share takes ages too....
I doubt it, but you run a hardline and see.
it must be an option someone
maybe i'm looking at iftop wrong, do you know another bandwidth monitor i can use? maybe the numbers are messed....i dunno
I don't know really.  All I can do is give you possiblilities.  You could just use trial and error, like improve your location on one or both ends.
For best performance 2.4GHz needs clear line of sight.
